revisions.rev:
A '''disabled''' person is one who has a disability that interferes with his or her abiltiy to perform one or more activities of everyday living. For example, locomotion, speech, getting dressed, going outside, communicating with others.
Note:This definition is based on the one given in the Americans with Disabilities Act, a law in the USA, enacted in July 1990. : [[Physical Disability]] :: [[Mobility Impairment]] ::: [[Paralysis]] ::: [[Amputation]] ::: [[Multiple Sclerosis]] ::: [[Parkinsons Disease]] ::: [[Cerebral Palsy]] ::: [[Muscular Dystropy]] ::: [[Arthritis]] :::: [[Rheumatoid Arthitis]] :::: [[OsteoArthritis]] ::: [[Stroke]] :::... :: [[Visual Impairment]] ::: [[Blindness]] ::: [[Low Vision]] ::: [[Color Blindness]] ::: [[Cataract]] :::... :: [[Hearing Impairment]] :: [[Chronic Disease]] ::: [[Cancer]] ::: [[AIDS]] ::: [[Renal Failure]] ::: [[Cystic Fibrosis]] ::: [[Tuberculosis]] ::: [[Diabetes]] :::: [[Hypoglycemia]] ::: [[Chronic Fatigue Syndrome]] :::... :: [[Spinal Cord Injury]] :: [[Traumatic Brain Injury]] ::.... : [[Mental Disability]] :: [[Learning disability]] :: [[Alzheimers_Disease|Alzheimers Disease]] :: [[Phobia]] ::: [[Agoraphobia]] ::: [[Acrophobia]] ::: [[Aleurophobia]] :::... :: [[Anxiety Disorder]] :: [[Depression]] :: [[Bipolar Disorder]] :: [[Obsessive Compulsive Disorder]] :: [[Schizophrenia]] ::.... : [[Developmental Disability]] :: [[Dyslexia]] :: [[Down syndrome]] :: [[Attention Deficit Disorder]] and [[ADHD]] :: [[Hyperactivity]] :: [[Autism]] ::.... : [[Other Disabilities]] ::[[Substance Abuse]] ::: [[Alcoholism]] ::: [[Nicotine addiction]] ::: [[Illegal Drug Abuse]] ::: [[Perscription Drug Abuse]] :::... :: [[Senility]] [[/Disability Etiquette]] for discussion please see [[Wikipedia commentary/Disability Etiquette]]) See also: * [[sideshow]] /Talk
